Reviews.Title: “Stinky”
Reviews.Author: Masias
Reviews.Content: Ask them where is the gym no gym liers where is thehamam no hamam liers the biliards nothing the pool nowhere and they have fotos of them never I mean it don't make the same mistake they don't speak English small rooms like in jail I can speak for hours it's better to forget

Reviews.Title: “Dimitris - April 2012”
Reviews.Author: Dimitris t
Reviews.Content: First I would like to point that the hotel's location is not opposite the tram station as mentioned in web site. It is 500 meters away and not easy to find because there are no street names and few people know it. The hotel is not 4 star, 3 would be much. The towels had holes, the windows don't close well enough, the view is awful, the curtains 20 years old ..., the staff speaking few english, wi-fi was out of order in rooms and you must have great patience to use the elevators as they stop whenever they like. Breakfast coffee was tasteless, juice not enough for all tourists ..., omelette watery and tables not clean Only price was ok but with the above luxourius facilities I wouldn't suggest it to anyone !!!!

Reviews.Title: “A complete disgrace of Istanbul.”
Reviews.Author: Vagianos00
Reviews.Content: When you check the hotel's website, it seems ok. If you stay for a night you will just want to sue them... The stuff doesn't even speak English. Tiny, awful, dirty rooms. No wi-fi in room although they said it was provided. Old torn apart towels. I wasn't brave enough to try their hamam. If this is a 4 star hotel, I'm Marilynn Monroe...

Reviews.Title: “Not a four star hotel”
Reviews.Author: manolis_12
Reviews.Content: First of all the hotel is not in a good location.The location has a lot of traffic.The second problem is the facilities the itself was clean but the bathroom was bad.The water is was very cold,i cannot take a bath.The third problem was the spa facilities nothing worked.The good was the view on the top floor restaraunt and the food.The staff of the hotel was ok.

Reviews.Title: “great views of the Sea of Marmara”
Reviews.Author: Gabz_10
Reviews.Content: Our room was a bit pokey but the fantastic view more than made up for it. The hotel had problems with the water supply to the rooms over several days but eventually they got it sorted. They have terrific breakfast on the top floor and all frontline staff are extremely helpful, Genius the porter in particular stands out. I would recommend this hotel if you payed under US$100/night. Internet access all over Turkey can be a bit hit and miss, here you needed to use their computers,but it did cost.

Reviews.Title: “Not a good experience”
Reviews.Author: SaraDania08
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in the centre of town, and that's just about the only positive thing i can say about the place. Don't be fooled by the photos on the website - the rooms are much smaller and are not nearly as fascinating the visually modified photos are. The view was terrible and dirty and we simply refused to open the window as we didn't want air from the outside coming in. The shower seemed impressive from a distance, but once you get close, you'll find that its not well cleaned and maintained; all the fancy functions don't work either. The same goes for the toilet...dirty and toilet seat wasn't steadily attached. We found used tissues and toothpicks on the carpet, room was badly lit, and the air-cond blows room temparature air. I was horribly disgusted when my hand had sticky substance stuck to it when i held the phone by the mouth piece. The coffee and tea dispenser in the restaurant was not well cleaned and neither were the plates (that's what my friend told me when she tried to grab a plate for breakfast. She found at least 4 of such, in the stack of plates left out for guests to use). The lifts are also small, so we had to use the stairs on more than one occasion throughout our 2-day stay there. II never really got to experience the warmth and friendliness of the hotel staff to comment much, but I do appreciate the fact that they were able to fix the non-functioning light in our room within a few hours. So, I guess the service was ok. In short, unless you've completely run out of options, try to avoid this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this hotel”
Reviews.Author: sousou20011
Reviews.Content: Rooms very small, the hotel is well located but service is bad. I had confirmation for my first night, I arrived, the hotel is full, we spent the night in different hotels 3 stars and 2 stars. No way to discuss with them. Food is not good.

Reviews.Title: “average”
Reviews.Author: aikcos
Reviews.Content: The most ugly room I have ever stayed. The water pumps need to be repaired. Average breakfast, bad quality tea and coffee. Too much noise from the exterior of the hotel and the nearby hotel rooms. The elevator misfunctioned.

Reviews.Title: “I think, the hotel 5 star...”
Reviews.Author: canGUNDOGAN
Reviews.Content: I'd been istanbul for one week and I took a room in this hotel. all of things is very well, if I'll go again istanbul, I will make reservation same place. when I compare price and quality, ikbal deluxe is perfect...

Reviews.Title: “Great Place, clean and comfortable!”
Reviews.Author: CarlosandGigi
Reviews.Content: Elegant and friendly. Excellent amenities. Great staff, helpful, polite and professional (Particularly a lady named Gamze Sahin) Will go back anytime! Also Istanbul is wonderful! Turkiye sebiyorum!!!!

Reviews.Title: “A decent downtown hotel”
Reviews.Author: Matias66
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights over the weekend with 3 of my old friends in two twins. The rooms are well furnished, & clean, beds good, but there is quite little storage space for the cloths etc. Specially the other room was a bit cramped & impractical, but the washrooms & shower serve the purpose. The breakfast buffet is pretty generous though more like Eastern European type than Scandinavian. The complimentary (because of delayed check-in) dinner buffet was OK, but nothing to be remembered. The lobby bar is "a healthy bar" with non-alcholic drinks. The staff is attentive and friendly both in the restaurant and reception. It was our first time Istanbul, and the aim was to familiarize with the main tourist attractions. For that purpose, the location of the hotel is perfect; "everything is almost within walking distance". Also the tram stop is only 100 meters up the street.

Reviews.Title: “Very very ordinary indeed”
Reviews.Author: R0ck07
Reviews.Content: An Australian tour company made the booking for our tour group,rooms small,badly furnished,some with no working air conditioning a very noisy area,but central,staff tried hard but service was very very average,just cannot recommend ,rating 1 star at best

Reviews.Title: “ABSOLUTELY THE BESTTTTTTTTT”
Reviews.Author: aaa89
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our honeymoond in july 2010...it was one of the best trips of my life thanks to ikbal hotel...the staff were more than amazing and i would stay here again for sure....special thanks to mehmet who was a great hotel manager...sertac, mahmut, and ersum were also amazing staff and made us feel very welcome and comfortable...staff were ver helpful and cleaners were very trustworthy and reliable(nothing went missing)...food was amazing...room service is a must....will come back to istanbul just ot stay in this hotel once again for sureeee!!!...thanks for making our trip one of the best!

Reviews.Title: “awful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Issaf
Reviews.Content: the hotel is very bad... room was small - smells yakki - dirty bath - the worst view ever from the window - poor breakfast. the hotel located in Laleli ( wholesaler Market) where you should buy minimum 5 pieces of the same dress!! and most guests were Russian merchants. Our stay in istanbul was 6 nights & we where obliged to stay 2 nights until we moved to another hotel. i have been there once and my advise is: find another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “What an experience !!”
Reviews.Author: bcDubai
Reviews.Content: Jet Airways - Jet Privilege - Blue Plus Member No. 137474794 We just returned from a four day stay in istanbul. Having travelled in a group of forty plus people, we had loads of fun... Ikbal Deluxe Hotel is quite different from most of the hotels I have stayed in. The best part about the hotel is the location which is in close proximity to all the main attractions. Its actually walking distance from the Grand Bazar. The hotel has leased some shops commercially at the ground level so the entrance doesn't look like a hotel. Its only once you are in front of the hotel and read the sign board that you realize you've arrived. The hotel is surronded by other hotels with the same concept and mostly sell upmarket leather goods. The staff are friendly in the hotel although language seemed to be a bit of a problem. I got an upgrade to an Executive room. The layout on each floor is a bit confusing with small corridors leading to certain rooms, which takes a while to get used to. The room itself is good - the decor, which neat was different from my tastes - blue velvet curtains, blue velevt sofas and a blue velvet bedspread. The Plasma monitor (17 inch screen) just showed 1 English news channel while the other 50 odd channels transmitted just turkish stations (including CNN Turk). The bathrooms were good with a mini jacuzzi and some fresh cinnamon soap provided daily. The towels were also perfumed. Our package included a daily buffet breakfast which was served in the restaurant on the 8th floor. The views from the resturant are panaromic and the buffet was elobarate and there was sufficient variety. I even tried out the a la carte menu , where the food was tasty and the portion size huge. The gaming room for kids was nice with the coin operated machines. The sauna and steam room are complimentary only between 1pm and 5pm and chrgeable afterwards although the health club usage was free. The only thing which was a bit irritating was the power sensors in the corridors. While it is good to be environmentally friendly, areas like the public corridors need some lighting on all the time. It becomes very difficult to find your way when the corridors are not straight and you have to wait till the light come on... The other thing was no newspapers..for a hotel which has a four star rating I expect them to provide a daily newspaper... Overall, it was quite an experience and I don't mind staying in the hotel again

Reviews.Title: “KRASNOYARSK”
Reviews.Author: Mihail031
Reviews.Content: We always stop in this hotel all family. A place very convenient, nearby there are all sights. In the hotel all of us arranges, and services. We recommend.:)

Reviews.Title: “ghetto hotel based in the slums!!”
Reviews.Author: nj786
Reviews.Content: this hotel is absolutely CRAP!!..Having travelled to many countries all over the world, i can honestly say this is probably the worst hotel i have stayed in. Staff were rude, unhelpful and majority couldn't understand english. Rooms were appaling interms of what u book is not whast u get, poor A/C and the cleaning is beyond satisfactory. Take my advice, if u want a hassle free time during your visit to turkey, don't stay at this hotel..i made that mistake!

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: Apekoek
Reviews.Content: I'm happy for the other people who had a good experience, but mine was just awful. Only upside of the hotel was the location, that's it. Ok, I didn't paid that much, but there are some basics which I may expect at least. What happened: - Reception insinuated my best friend was a prostitute when she visited me. I was like WTF? - How can I do business if the internetconnection is bad! Wireless disconnected all the time and the signal was poor (or even wasn't able to connect at all). - Next day, my Lira and Euro coins mixed up so I took all the Euro money out of my pocket. When I left the room and came back later, guess what......money was gone! It was only 8 or 9 Euro, but that doensn't matter. I didn't report to avoid hassle for the employee. - Next day, I took my flight ticket out of the deposit to reconfirm my flight for the next day. I putted the ticket on the desk and had some food, came back....guess what.....ticket was GONE! I had big problems with getting back home, cause it was a paper ticket with red flightcoupon. You guess if I will come back?!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel with excellent service”
Reviews.Author: PlamenP
Reviews.Content: I visited this hotel last year by chance because it was recommended to me from a friend of mine. I went to Istanbul on business and I needed a good hotel with good location because I wanted to combine business with pleasure of exploring tourist landmarks. I dont regret that I choose Ikbal hotel. My room was fresh and sunny and I had sea view. The breakfast was so variable - I enjoyed it much. The staff is well trained and they helped me for everything. Also the location is excellent - just some minutes walk to the old city center of Istanbul. I can say that during my stay I completed my duties successfully and I was very happy from my accommodation and my tourist program. I can recommend this hotel to tourists also to business travellers. If I have chance I will go back there also again.

Reviews.Title: “I love this place!”
Reviews.Author: kewlbabe
Reviews.Content: This place is very lovely and the people are so nice. The bed is comfortable and I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “I like this hotel!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: AlainaVarna
Reviews.Content: Friendly and inviting staff. My room had a great view of the sea, was well maintained and had a very nice and modern furniture. Quick and efficient check-in and check-out. The breakfast at the hotel, was very rich and during my all stayng there was a great variety so I could enjoy different breakfast every morning. I enjoyed very much also the modern gym, and the lovely jakkuzi on the roof of the hotel. It will be my home in Istanbul.

HotelInfo.Name: Ikbal Deluxe Hotel Istanbul
HotelInfo.Address: Koska Cad No 43 Laleli, Istanbul 34470, Turkey
